content: Quite liked this one all things considered. Am a bit annoyed at the lack of option to save at any point but for the most part, I found the premise and the storyline quite enjoyable

I actually purchased this book. You are a normal person that suddenly gains the ability to stop time. What this story does well is sell the normal person part. Working for the life insurance company was kind of boring and the boss fights were somewhat anticlimactic. The characters in game are very well developed and the plot was good too. The author did a great job with world building and tying up loose ends at the end. Its got romance and replayability. Overall it's a good read.

I love it! There's so many different routes you can do! Two things I'd like to say though; Firstly, the relationship point system is somewhat inaccurate. Ex- The main character always treats their roommates as friends, even when they're labeled "enemy". Secondly, can you make a route where befriending Barnabas is possible? The most you can do at the moment is get him to trust you enough to be led to the scientist. The most relationship points I've gotten with him so far is "adversary (71)".
The writting is quite good and the story is enjoyable.

userName: Please help Jimmy has a gun
content: good story not that many love interests or character interactions boring at times
this really needs a sequel. one of my favorite Choice games

great game. came here from zombie exodus, and expected the same. a little bit dissappointed due to the ending and the choices, but is still a great game overall. and if there was an illustration like ZE, could you please add it? the illustrations are cool.
this game was good, and i hope a sequel is forthcoming.
this game is hella short but the story is worth it

Masterpiece.

Generally Choose Your Own Adventure stories don't let you have that much of 
a character. You get to control who you are, what you do, how you interact 
with others and what kind of life you want. The villain and friends (or 
enemies) are well defined and aren't just background characters in your 
story. Overall this game was fantastic.
It's an interesting game. Though a bit on the easy side, but there's nothing wrong with that. Could have a more fulfilling ending, but overall it was worth its price.

I didn't feel like the decisions (or characters themselves) had much substance.  I played it twice and it looks like the choices don't really affect where the story goes. In many cases the choice is not so much what you do but in what order which doesn't give them enough weight.
As ironic as it sounds, I have wasted a great deal of time on "A wise use of time". Better IMO than the hero-choice series. Hope this gets a sequel... I would buy that in a heart beat.
Another great book
Game was great story was compelling as well as the writing it was said that the fact that it ended but all in all a good or great game all in all a great game

Absolutely phenomenal. One of the best, most believable versions of time manipulation I've ever seen. The story is lengthy, the characters are interesting, and the plot has a few good twists and surprises, and the end is both satisfying and open-ended enough to allow for a sequel (though I don't think it needs one). I'm happy to say that it offers some very difficult choices, and on several occasions I found myself stopping and analyzing the options. Nicely done!

I thought it was gonna be like another story about someone suddenly got power to control time out of nowhere and we can do whatever we please. You proved me wrong. The story is surprisingly deep and moral choices are lurking everywhere. Good job to the author, you just made me addicted to this kind of games
Well, the game is great in the first reading, but it didn't engage me enough to make me replay, great plot and great redaction tho.

I enjoyed it greatly! It wasn't perfect, bit right now in my life it really gave me some good feelings. The writing was good, and kept me interested. My biggest complaint was the lack of alternate gender options.
It was amazing so many options, twists, turns, even loops.

A wise use of Time falls straight into the CoG-lite bracket, with the underperformance I should have expected by now from such games. A premise that just begs for an intricate,  multi-plot choice system, is instead served with a beelined plot. Said plot is tepid, the choices amount to a different shade of the same outcome, and the surrounding characters have the flavour and depth of a sheet of cardboard. It might waste an hour, but is worth avoiding for CoG players after a title with substance and grit.
There are better choices of games.
Most in depth story I have read where you can make your own decisions that alters the story with every decision effecting the stories events greatly making their many different endings

Samurai of Hyuga and Fatehaven are so much better, but it was a good read nonetheless. The most interesting part of the plot is the mysterious disappearance of her father, but it was only hinted at. Think I need to go through and make different choices so I can afford to hire the investigator.
Meaningful choices. Good writing.

This was an excellent piece of interactive literature; easy to read, yet intellectually enticing. Can't wait to reread it using a different style of choices

Great story, great possibilities, great choices, great app. Just like all of your apps. Keep it up!

This is the first game of this type that I have been moved to review after the first time through. The writing is very good, fluent and fun. While not quite as amusing to me  (nor quite as long) as "So You Think You're Possessed," it's still fun and interesting. Unlike "Possessed," it ends on a satisfying note, so whether there's a sequel or not, you get to feel like you've completed the game, which I think most people will appreciate. If you're a fan of this kind of game or this is your first, go ahead!
I loved it!! The ending that I had was sadish and will be a great memory for me to keep.
Loved it.

Read this a couple times a while back and just gone for another today, absolutely awesome. Not sure how it would work since everyone would have different endings but this needs a second part! Feel I've only just got into my relationships and they need to go on further!

The characters are interesting, there are many strands of narrative to follow, and overall it was the best game I've played in quite a while. It's got huge replay value and is definitely worth the price of a coffee.

I'm not entirely sure how I feel about this; on one hand I love the author and this particular book is long enough that it is well worth the price, on the other the "big bad" doesn't actually seem all that menacing or even really threatening and the subplots seem to overshadow the main one. One of the biggest problems that come with these games is failing to fully immerse the reader, a fate that befalls a lot of the books that come from this company.

For me, this is the only thing from Choice of Games that is approaching the quality of Choice of Robots. The game has an interesting premise, is pretty well-written, and suitably long to really get going. Would recommend. Cons? Romances are pretty shallow, and the game's antagonist is severely underdeveloped, but still a fun experience.
I really enjoyed it.
Really enjoyed it, hope theres a sequel with the time travel possibility.
I enjoy a good story and enjoy it I did. The story has you honestly thinking of your actions and what might happen. I would highly recommend this work to anyone who likes a good read.

This is easily one of my favorite "Choice of" games so far; the writing and stat system were both great, and I didn't notice any inconsistencies in the storytelling that sometimes happens in this genre of games.
This game is too linear for me.

The story was fantastic....and I get that there are multiple endings....but it's just too long to replay,  and after the ending I had, which was abrupt and did not seem like where my story was going, I'm a bit disappointed my adventure ended the way it did. Wish each ending was at least made to be conclusive.

It's a really long ( not 10 hours long ) and detailed story, but I wonder if they make another because every ending ends up a cliffhanger, so if I could know if another would be released that'll be great.
Liked it even though there wasn't much variation.

The best choose your own adventure book in a long time!! I even felt connected deeply to my character. It was captivating and longer than I expected it to be and it was just amazing. I hope to find more books like this one in the future. Until then, I will start reading it again.

I thoroughly enjoyed this game.  It reminded me of the books I used to read when I was younger. Having control of the adventures in the story will make it hard to put your smartphone or tablet down.  I highly recommend that others download this.  Before you know it, several hours will have passed.  It really is a lot of fun.
So worth the money. I hope this storyline goes on forever haha
Great replay value, but the romance sections seemed kind of lacking compared to other Choice games.

This is a very enjoyable game. It runs smoothly on my tablet, and I love the fact that it works in landscape as well as portrait modes (I wasn't sure if it would based on the photos above). The story is fun, but as a writer I have to say it feels forced quite often. Nobody runs into that many accidents, burglaries, etc around them every single day. I've played other, similar games by other companies that managed to pull off the ability to choose your adventure, shape your character (in even more depth than this game allows), etc without the storyline feeling so forced (read: fake), so I know it's possible to make that happen and wish the dev had found a better writer. Also, the story sometimes flat out ignores your decisions. For example, on one page I chose not to tell my roommates about my ability, but the very next page acknowledged that choice then said that I decided to tell them anyway because it wasn't fair to keep it from them. Annoying, as I had good reason to keep it from at least one of those people. Overall, it was more fun than not, but I'll probably stick with other devs' products in the future.

Fool me once, shame on me, fool me twice, shame on you. I see no improvement in the games published by choice of games, I'm never spending a cent on your games from now on. Decisions mostly affects stats, rarely affecting small details in the story and never affects the general progression of the story.

As the story progress our work life feel irrelevant and unimportant. The antagonist wasn't as threatening as my character gave him credits. Killing him gives me no satisfaction. It was too easy tbh. There were so many subplots the mainplot felt weak. The pacing failed to make me invested in the story.. Raj and Jeremy were rad tho.
Just finished my first playthrough, really enjoyed this game. The writing you publish is always spot-on. Keep up the good work, Choice of Games!! You're my favorite developer!
